title: AI system predicts protein fragments that can bind to or inhibit a target
summary: FragFold, developed by MIT Biology researchers, is a computational method with potential for impact on biological research and therapeutic applications.

title: How Should AI Liability Work? (Part I)
The latest open artifacts (#7): Alpaca era of reasoning models, China's continued dominance, and tons of multimodal advancements
summary: Artifacts Log 7. It'll continue to be a fun spring for AI researchers and practitioners.

title: Like human brains, large language models reason about diverse data in a general way
summary: A new study shows LLMs represent different data types based on their underlying meaning and reason about data in their dominant language.

title: MIT spinout maps the body’s metabolites to uncover the hidden drivers of disease
summary: ReviveMed uses AI to gather large-scale data on metabolites — molecules like lipids, cholesterol, and sugar — to match patients with therapeutics.

title: Grok 3 and an accelerating AI roadmap
summary: Where AI is heading, why 2024 felt slow, and shifting priorities of frontier laboratories.

title: This artist collaborates with AI and robots
summary: Many artists worry about the encroachment of artificial intelligence on artistic creation. But Sougwen Chung, a nonbinary Canadian-Chinese artist, instead sees AI as an opportunity for artists to embrace uncertainty and challenge people to think about technology and creativity in unexpected ways.  Chung’s exhibitions are driven by technology; they’re also live and kinetic, with the…
